title: Add explanation to supplemental parameter
body: For issue #340

title: Add Faker::Image
body: Faker::Image uses loremflickr.com in order to generate an url to a random image.

title: Retrieve All Job Titles
body: It would be pretty cool to be able to obtain all the job titles. Nifty feature in cases such as forms where users can pick their job titles.

title: Fix warnings in tests
body:
There were some warnings in test output. Some were regarding regex and
some regarding duplicate setup and teardown methods.

The warnings can be seen in this build:
[https://travis-ci.org/stympy/faker/jobs/118197388](https://travis-ci.org/stympy/faker/jobs/118197388)

The duplicacy was due to incorrect (or rather duplicate class names).
This PR fixes these issues and clears up all warnings from test output.

title: Feat ASIN codes
body:
Adds functionality for retrieving Amazon ASIN codes with Faker. My code is integrated into the pre-existing `Faker::Code` architecture (including README and tests)

Initially added 500 ASINs, but there are 826,269,703 more available to download for free [here](https://archive.org/details/asin_listing).

title: How do I include Faker's customisation without changing the files in the gem?
body:
According to customization section, I only need to include a YAML file in /lib/locales to add new options to Faker


en:
  faker:
    company:
      store_type: [Collection Point, Flagship Store, Cleaning Centre]
    address:
      postcode_cn: [310000,329999,430000,449999,100001,102600]
      province: [Zhejiang, Shanghai, Beijing, Guangzhou, Jiangsu, Fujian]
      city_cn: [Hangzhou, Wenzhou, Ningbo, Fuding]
      district: [Binjiang, Xiaoshan, Xihu, Xiacheng, Shangcheng]


This file is what I added, but when I use it in FactoryGirl. It still gave me the error like the following one:

NoMethodError: undefined method `district' for Faker::Address:Class

How do I include this file to Faker to make it work

title: Added Faker::Educator
body:
I have added `Faker::Educator`, including README.md usage instructions and tests.

```ruby
Faker::Educator.university #=> "Mallowtown Technical College"
Faker::Educator.secondary_school #=> "Iceborough Secodary College"
Faker::Educator.course #=> "Associate Degree in Criminology"
Faker::Educator.campus #=> "Vertapple Campus"
```

title: Added Faker::Job
body:
I have added Faker::Job, which is used via;

```ruby
Faker::Job.title #=> "Lead Accounting Associate"
Faker::Job.field #=> "Manufacturing"
Faker::Job.key_skill #=> "Teamwork"
```

Included as well are tests and an update to the README.md.

title: Faker::Time failing tests intermittently
body:
On a fresh fetch from master, approximately 75% of the time one test within `test_faker_time.rb` fails;

Here is the failure;
```
===============================================================================
Failure:
  "5" expected to be included in Faker::Time::TIME_RANGES[:morning] range.
  <false> is not true.
test_time_period(TestFakerTime)
/Users/blah/Code/forks/faker/test/test_faker_time.rb:89:in `block (2 levels) in test_time_period'
/Users/blah/Code/forks/faker/test/test_faker_time.rb:88:in `each'
/Users/blah/Code/forks/faker/test/test_faker_time.rb:88:in `block in test_time_period'
/Users/blah/Code/forks/faker/test/test_faker_time.rb:80:in `times'
/Users/blah/Code/forks/faker/test/test_faker_time.rb:80:in `test_time_period'
     77:     from = Date.today
     78:     to   = Date.today + 15
     79: 
  => 80:     100.times do
     81:       period          = @time_ranges.keys.to_a.sample
     82:       period_range    = @time_ranges[period]
     83: 
===============================================================================
```

I'm happy to attempt to fix the issue, can I poke around in this code?

title: Extend library with Faker::Wine.
body:
Hi All,

I've enjoyed using faker on my personal projects and I wanted to give back!
I noticed that Faker::Beer was recently added to the library, so I thought why not wine?
I've added the appropriate files, data, tests, and documentation and I hope someone else finds my addition useful.

title: Fix time period test that could result in a flake test within 15 days…
body: … of a DST change. The random_time function of the Faker::Time class works by rolling the clock forward a random number of hours until it's in the right period. For example, for afternoon the clock will be rolled forward 12 to 17 hours from midnight. However, when DST starts this will result in a time of 13:xx to 18:xx, because of the extra hour added by DST. The opposite effect happens when DST ends. On these days the random_time parameter thus has a chance to generate an off-by-one hour time. This bug seems too small to fix compared to the complexity of the fix. However, for 15 days before the end or start of DST (or 30 days per year), the test as currently written, will flake. This change eliminates the flake by fixing the dates used for the test as non-DST dates.

title: Faker::Time::between doesn't respect requested period
body: Faker::Time::between doesn't respect the requested period. The unit test of this method consistently fails due to this.

title: Fix Faker::Internet.safe_email makes bad emails for some locales #272
Add msisdn format to phone_number
body: Added the method Faker::PhoneNumber.msisdn to simplify the use of phone number format in telecom issues. For instance, this cover only pt_br locale but can be merged to all others locales.

title: [feature] - Support phone code in phone number module
body:
I have a problem when creating a phone code for user model. After trying and looking at ffaker code, unfortunately, faker doesn't support phone code now. 
I think we should add this feature because it makes user easier to generate phone code correctly.

Here is my suggest about it. What's your opinion?

title: [feature] - Support currency code, name generate
body:
I think we should add support for currency code and name to make our faker more flexible.
About data i copy from google https://developers.google.com/public-data/docs/canonical/currencies_csv
What's your opinion about that?

title: Get "invalid date (ArgumentError)" when generating a birthday at 29 Feb 2016
body:
The error happen if: 
- the generator run at 29 Feb && the year of (t.year - 18) don't exits 29 Feb date.

title: Can't run Faker::Date.birthday
body:
Looks like I can't run `Faker::Date.birthday` in Rails `4.2.5`, Ruby `2.2.3`

Do you need anymore info to reproduce this?
```
pry(main)> Faker::Date.birthday
ArgumentError: invalid date
0: /Users/kg/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.2.3/gems/faker-1.6.3/lib/faker/date.rb:35:in `new'
1: /Users/kg/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.2.3/gems/faker-1.6.3/lib/faker/date.rb:35:in `birthday'
```

title: Make Faker::Number return integers and floats instead of strings
body:
Fixes #237 

I think `Faker::Number` should return integers and floats instead of strings.

title: OmniAuth ready responses
body:
is it a good idea to have already predefined omniauth response hashes (for the common providers like fb/twitter/linkedIn/etc.)?
maybe in the internet module (ex. `Faker::Internet::Omniauth.#{provider}` )

title: First attempt to replace test-unit with rspec
body: we can move to most used testing library rspec for our unit tests. I have added the rspec gem and modified the default rake task to run test-unit and rspec tests. And also moved address tests from test-unit to rspec.

title: adding test for first and last name as well
Faker::PhoneNumber.cell_phone not enforcing locale
body:
I've noticed that when you use the cell phone method after setting the locale, it does not enforce the area code rules.  notice in the code sample below, the first result is area code, "126" which is invalid.

```ruby
Faker::Config.locale = 'en-US'
10.times map{ Faker::PhoneNumber.cell_phone }
#=>  [ "1-126-339-8245",
#=> "187.000.3075",
#=> "(956) 743-8134",
#=> "227.630.6904",
#=> "(294) 316-8197",
#=> "(798) 776-1679",
#=> "129.322.0758",
#=> "656-980-4693",
#=> "153-403-7461",
#=> "313.683.7081" ]
```

title: Ref 490, adding name_with_middle option
body:
Adding option to return full name which contains "#{first_name} #{middle_name} #{last_name}".
Added tests for same.

title: Full name with middle name under Faker::Name
body: Now Faker::Name.name returns only "#{first_name} #{last_name}". There should be a way to have full name which contains middle name also.

title: Ref #487 added middle_name
body:
Adding middle_name for Faker::Name.
Returning first_name only as usually middle name is first_name of parent only.

title: Faker::BankAccount
body:
I've got a marketplace app I'm building, so it'd be nice to be able to generate fake bank account data.  There's a few formats, but in the USA we use ABA-RTN codes, international stuff is SWIFT-BIC and in Europe they have IBAN.  It'd also be fun to generate a bank name.

I would build this myself but frankly I have no idea how to make a random number which conforms to a checksum, and don't have any clue if these systems reserve "example" spaces for these purposes.  With a little handholding, I'm sure I could get it done.

At least the ABA-RTN part is easy (it's a series of checksummed numbers), SWIFT-BIC too (it's just string combining).  IBAN is a terrifying trainwreck of a format, though, just as complex as international phone numbers.  We'd probably just need a list of valid example codes.

I guess the API would be something like this:

```ruby
Faker::BankAccount.routing_number
# => '1291131673'
Faker::BankAccount.routing_number(true) # true to use the rare "fraction" notation
# => '11-3167/1210'
Faker::BankAccount.account_number
# => '0114584906'
Faker::BankAccount.iban
# => 'GR16 0110 1250 0000 0001 2300 695'
Faker::BankAccount.swift
# => 'DEUTDFF'
Faker::BankAccount.institution_name
# => 'Ontario Agriculture Bank'
# => 'First Bank of Osaka'
# => 'Commerce Bank of Stockholm'
# => 'Great American Sperm Bank'
```

EDIT: after further research, it appears the check digits are rarely used on checks (leave it to banking to ignore important things) so we might just leave them off?

title: Add Middle Name Field to Faker::Name
body:
I would like to generate middle names on the `Name` object. I'd happily dev. 
Any objections @stympy ?
